result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen L Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen L Young

defendant.name: Young, Stephen L
defendant.address: 2742 Biron Drive E, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty Richard Bender

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Stephen L. Young in court with attorney Richard E. Bender. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard this morning are 15CF-40 and 15CF-413.

9:09 AM Court calls cases.

There is a plea agreement.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

15CF-40: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 3.  Counts 2, 4 and 5 to be dismissed and read in.

15CF-413: Defendant will plead to charge. 

Atty Knaapen states plea agreement.
Atty Bender concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-40: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-40: Count 3: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-413: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Bender for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-40: Count 1: Court finds Defendant Guilty
15CF-40: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-40: Count 3: Court finds Defendant Guilty
15CF-40: Count 4: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-40: Count 5: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-413: Court finds Defendant Guilty

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Bender makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF-40:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
AODA and comply with any recommendations with respect to treatment
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Obtain and maintain full time employment during period of probation
Submit DNA sample
Write short letter of apology to N.G., apologizing for the behavior
Write short letter of apology to arresting officer, apologizing for the behavior
Comply with any recommendations as stated by agent
Pay DNA surcharge
Pay costs

15CF-40:
Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period fo 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs

15CF-413:
Pay a fine of $300 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Cash bond of $850 may be applied to fine and costs

Court addresses voting rights and firearms rights and right to appeal. CR-243 form is to be filled out before the end of the day.

10:45 a.m. Attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Karl Schmidt states his client is in the Wood County jail.  Motion for Withdrawal as Counsel (public defendar appointment). Wood County granted withdrawal on Wood County case.
State has no objection.
BTC:  Motion - Granted
Atty Schmidt will draft order for Judge to sign.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 11:00 am.
to Withdraw as Counsel for Defendant with Proposed Order

Defendant Stephen L. Young in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
No contact with Nicole Golomski, Justin Coyle and Jarrod Coyle.

Defendant Stephen L. Young in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

State recommends a signature bond with conditions as stated  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
